controlReports.name: Writable hostPath mount

ruleResponses.alertMessage: pod: etcd-david-virtualbox has: etcd-certs as hostPath volume
pod: etcd-david-virtualbox has: etcd-data as hostPath volume
pod: kube-controller-manager-david-virtualbox has: flexvolume-dir as hostPath volume
pod: storage-provisioner has: tmp as hostPath volume
Deployment: ca-webhook has: docker-socket-volume as hostPath volume
Deployment: ca-websocket has: docker-socket-volume as hostPath volume
DaemonSet: kube-proxy has: xtables-lock as hostPath volume

controlReports.remediation: Try to refrain from using host path mount. You can use ARMO runtime protection (encryption capability) to encrypt these files.
controlReports.description: Mounting host directory to the container can be used by attackers to get access to the underlying host.
